replies.message: Hi Laura, 100% of our packaging is 100% recyclable. We’ve spent many years ensuring all of our drinks packaging is fully recyclable, from our lids to the labels, the type of glue we use to stick on the labels and the colour of PET plastic. Thanks
Glad to hear it. I hope that it's a material that is widely accepted by recycling schemes too!

making your bottles recyclable doesn't stop them from getting into our oceans thou. Making them recyclable doesn't make them bio degradable either....  Come on coca cola, make a huge step and start saving our planet..

Everyone is so hung up on the recycling aspect. That's what they want you to focus on. Go do some research on the coca cola bottling plants and the process of making their drinks. The company is systematically stripping this planet of water!
They don't use recycled materials though, the bottles have always been recyclable.. don't let them make out that they're saints all of a sudden

Michelle Yvette Derham water is an infinite resource. It's like energy. It can never be destroyed or created, only cycled into different forms. Nobody can remove water from the planet. Except astronauts, but even they fetch it back.

Hi Luke, 100% of our packaging is 100% recyclable. We’ve spent many years ensuring all of our drinks packaging is fully recyclable, from our lids to the type of glue we use to stick on the labels and the colour of PET plastic. Thanks
Steve Craft please go read the article. It's quite informative. Xx

making your bottles recyclable doesn't stop them from getting into our oceans thou. Making them recyclable doesn't make them bio degradable either....  Come on coca cola, make a huge step and start saving our planet..

Hi Craig, at this stage our focus is on recovering all of our packaging so none of it ends up as litter or in the oceans. However, we’re working hard to ensure our packaging is as sustainable as possible. When plastic packaging is responsibly disposed of, it can be recycled and used again and again. We’ve also been researching and creating alternatives to oil based plastics, such as our PlantBottle™, which is the first-ever recyclable plastic bottle made from plants. We use the PlantBottle for all of our Honest Tea and Smartwater range here in Great Britain and are always looking at ways that we can expand its use across our portfolio.
